This sketch consists of a single face with one loop, made up of 12 connected lines. Afterwards, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch by setting the euler angles as (0, 0, 0) and translation vector as (0, 0, 0.0125). Note that the depth of this operation is set to 0.0125 units towards and opposite the normal direction. Extrude the 3D Sketch along the Z-axis to generate the 3D model. The height of the extrusion is determined by the sketch_scale property (0.025 units). The prism has a length of 0.75 units, width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.025 units. Finally, the resulting shape depicts a simple three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism is composed of two rectangular faces and two rectangular sides, all connected by straight edges. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length (0.75 x 2), 1 unit in width (0.75 x 2), and 1 unit in height (0.025). The prism is centered on a white background.</description>
